summary.para: Adds a task to the scheduler's background queue.

param.name: prt
param.para: A pointer to an instance of an interface representing the task to add to the queue.

param.name: rtoid
param.para: A GUID identifying the owner of the task. This information can be used to group tasks for later or by owner.

param.name: lParam
param.para: A pointer to a user-defined DWORD value allowing the task to be identified within the tasks owned by rtoid. This is used to identify single tasks or to subgroup them, for instance associating the task with a particular item such as an item in a ListView. This parameter can be zero.

param.name: dwPriority
param.para: One of the following values assigning the task's priority. Response to this priority depends on the cooperation of the other tasks being executed. New tasks are inserted in the queue in priority order. If a task of a low priority is currently under execution when a higher priority task is added, the scheduler attempts to suspend the task under execution. That lower priority task is resumed when the higher priority task(s) are completed.
Accept the default priority assigned to the task by the scheduler.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Counts tasks with the same owner ID in the scheduler's queue.

param.name: rtoid
param.para: A GUID identifying the owner of the tasks. Supplying a specific ID will count only those tasks tagged with that owner ID. To count all items in the queue, pass TOID_NULL.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Removes tasks from the scheduler's background queue.

param.name: rtoid
param.para: A GUID identifying the owner of the tasks to remove.

param.name: lParam
param.para: A pointer to a user-defined DWORD value that allows the task to be identified within the tasks owned by rtoid. Set this value to 0 to remove all tasks for the owner specified by rtoid.

param.name: bWaitIfRunning
param.para: TRUE if you want a currently running task to complete before removing it, FALSE otherwise.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Sets the release status and background thread timeout for the current task.

param.name: dwReleaseStatus
param.para: Immediately cease execution of the current task when the instance is released.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.
